author: Special Correspondent
text:
A representative of People for Animals (PFA), a forum led by Union Minister Maneka Gandi, has lodged a complaint with the Collector and the Superintendent of Police alleging conduct of sporting activities involving bulls in some of the villages here in violation of the Supreme Court ban on ‘jallikattu,’ rekla (bullock cart) race and related sports.

In a representation addressed to the Collector, S. Sivakumar, Managing Trustee, PFA Madurai, claimed that a bull fell into a well when ‘manju virattu’, a sport similar in nature to ‘jallikattu’, was conducted illegally at Keezhavalavu near here on Monday.

Expressing pain over such incidents, he requested the Collector to initiate appropriate action against the violators of court order.

Marking a copy of his representation to the Superintendent of Police too, he requested the district administration to also create awareness among the villagers of the consequences of defying the Supreme Court ban.
title: Forum led by Maneka alleges conduct of ‘manju virattu’
